results.description: Compare at-the-money implied volatility (call, 30d) to realized close-to-close volatility (30d). Applied SUGGESTION1 by combining implied_volatility_call_30 and historical_volatility_30. SUGGESTION2 not applied (no vector fields). SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage ~0.6958/0.6981 > 0.6). SUGGESTION4: used fields with moderate-to-high userCount. Confidence set to 0.78 because implied-realized spreads are a common, persistent tradeable signal but can be noisy.

Ratio of implied call IV to realized volatility over 60 days. S1 used two fields implied_volatility_call_60 and historical_volatility_60. S2 not applied. S3 not applied (coverage >0.6). S4 chosen implied_volatility_call_60 has high userCount. Confidence 0.76: ratio normalizes level differences and often predictive.

Short-term increase in implied IV measured as ts_delta of implied_volatility_call_10 over 5 days. S1 used single field (focused short-term). S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 implied_volatility_call_10 has high alphaCount. Confidence 0.65: short-term momentum can indicate near-term repricing.

results.idea: Long-term vs short-term IV term slope (270d - 30d)
results.description: Term-structure slope: long-dated implied call IV minus short-dated implied call IV. S1 used implied_volatility_call_270 and implied_volatility_call_30. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 both fields have very high userCount/alphaCount. Confidence 0.82: term slope is robust for carry/term premium strategies.

Implied put IV minus call IV to measure skew. S1 used implied_volatility_put_30 and implied_volatility_call_30. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 used high-use fields. Confidence 0.8: skew is a strong risk-premium indicator.

Compare implied_volatility_mean_30 to historical_volatility_30. S1 used both mean and realized fields. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 chosen implied_volatility_mean_30 has reasonable userCount. Confidence 0.75: mean implied vs realized indicates persistent mispricing.

Cross-sectional zscore of implied_volatility_call_120 to detect relative expensive/cheap underlyings. S1 used implied_volatility_call_120 (single but powerful). S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 high userCount. Confidence 0.77: cross-sectional zscore is reliable for short-term mean reversion

results.idea: Realized volatility acceleration (ts_delta of 30d hv over 10d)
results.description: Momentum of realized volatility: ts_delta(historical_volatility_30, 10). S1 used historical_volatility_30. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 historical_volatility_30 has moderate userCount. Confidence 0.63: realized vol momentum can precede option repricing.

Compare parkinson_volatility_60 vs historical_volatility_60 to capture intraday range-based deviation. S1 used both fields. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 fields have reasonable userCount. Confidence 0.7: range vs close-to-close differences reveal missed intraday moves.

Long minus intermediate implied IV normalized: divide(subtract(implied_volatility_call_720, implied_volatility_call_120), implied_volatility_call_120). S1 used two implied fields. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 used high-use fields. Confidence 0.74: curvature signals term premium shifts.

Ratio of put IV to call IV to capture relative demand for downside protection. S1 used implied_volatility_put_90 and implied_volatility_call_90. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 both fields have good alphaCount. Confidence 0.79: ratio is robust for hedging-demand signals.

Use implied_volatility_mean_skew_90 as direct skew metric and zscore it cross-sectionally. S1 used this single skew field. S2 not applied. S3 not required (coverage ~0.6869). S4 mean_skew fields have moderate userCount. Confidence 0.66: skew metrics are informative but noisier.

ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_120, 10) - ts_delta(historical_volatility_120, 10) to capture divergence between expected and realized momentum. S1 used two fields. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 selected high alphaCount fields. Confidence 0.72: divergence often precedes reversals.

ts_zscore(implied_volatility_call_30, 20) to detect short-term extreme IV levels vs recent history. S1 used implied_volatility_call_30. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 high userCount. Confidence 0.75: zscore mean-reversion is standard and effective.

ts_delta(historical_volatility_10, 1) minus (ts_mean(historical_volatility_30,30)). S1 used historical_volatility_10 and historical_volatility_30. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 fields have adequate userCount. Confidence 0.6: short-term surprises can be noisy.

results.idea: IV skew steepening indicator (short skew change)
results.description: ts_delta(subtract(implied_volatility_put_20, implied_volatility_call_20), 5) tracking recent skew shifts. S1 used put & call 20d. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 moderate userCounts. Confidence 0.71: skew shifts often reflect changing tail risk demand.

subtract(implied_volatility_mean_30, parkinson_volatility_30) to detect intraday vs implied expectation mismatch. S1 used mean implied and parkinson. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 used mean implied field which has good alphaCount. Confidence 0.68: captures intraday-range underpricing/overpricing.

results.idea: IV momentum zscore (60d ts_zscore of ts_delta)
results.description: ts_zscore(ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_60, 5), 20) to rank momentum extremes cross-sectionally. S1 used single field. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 chosen for stable signal. Confidence 0.7: momentum in IV tends to mean-revert after extremes.

divide(subtract(implied_volatility_call_150, implied_volatility_call_30), implied_volatility_call_30). S1 used two call IV tenors. S2 N/A. S3 not needed. S4 both fields with decent userCount. Confidence 0.73: normalized slope captures relative premium.

subtract(implied_volatility_mean_120, implied_volatility_put_120) to identify if mean implied exceeds put demand. S1 used two fields. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 fields have strong user/alpha counts. Confidence 0.69: signals differences in average market pricing vs directional downside demand.

zscore(historical_volatility_180) to find cross-sectional realized extremes. S1 used historical_volatility_180. S2 N/A. S3 not needed. S4 high userCount. Confidence 0.67: realized extremes often predict near-term mean reversion.

results.idea: Implied call volatility IR (ts_ir of returns)
results.description: ts_ir(ts_returns(implied_volatility_call_90, 5), 60) to capture risk-adjusted impulse in IV returns. S1 used implied_volatility_call_90. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 selected high-alpha field. Confidence 0.62: IR can detect persistent moves but is estimation-dependent.

subtract(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, ts_mean(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, 90)) to detect skew anomalies. S1 used single skew field across time. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 mean_skew userCount moderate. Confidence 0.6: skew time-series can be noisy.

zscore(parkinson_volatility_120) cross-sectional to detect large intraday-range stocks. S1 used parkinson_volatility_120. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 parkinson fields have good userCount. Confidence 0.64: intraday-range extremes are informative.

ts_zscore(implied_volatility_call_10, 5) to pick extreme recent spikes. S1 used short-term implied. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 high alphaCount. Confidence 0.66: short spikes often reverse intraday/short horizon.

ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_call_60, 30) measures volatility-of-vol; high values imply unstable option prices. S1 used single field. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 good userCount. Confidence 0.61: vol-of-vol is useful for sizing but noisier for direction.

subtract(implied_volatility_put_60, ts_mean(implied_volatility_put_60, 120)). S1 used put IV and its historical mean. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 put field userCount high. Confidence 0.7: mean reversion in put IV is tradable around hedging demand.

subtract(implied_volatility_call_90, parkinson_volatility_90). S1 used implied and parkinson. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 both fields present. Confidence 0.66: captures divergence between close-to-close expectations and intraday range.

ts_delta(subtract(implied_volatility_call_270, implied_volatility_call_30), 5). S1 used two tenor fields and ts_delta. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 high-use fields. Confidence 0.7: rapid term premium changes often reflect macro shifts.

subtract(implied_volatility_mean_20, implied_volatility_call_20) to find where call IV deviates from the mean. S1 used both fields. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 used available mean field. Confidence 0.68: divergence signals one-sided demand.

ts_zscore(ts_delta(subtract(implied_volatility_put_30, implied_volatility_call_30), 5), 20). S1 used put/call 30d across time. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 moderate userCount. Confidence 0.69: skew momentum identifies persistent demand shifts.

subtract(historical_volatility_180, historical_volatility_30) to detect longer-term regime vs short-term spikes. S1 used two realized vol fields. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 historical_volatility_180 has large userCount. Confidence 0.66: slope reveals regime shifts.

divide(subtract(implied_volatility_call_10, ts_mean(implied_volatility_call_10, 90)), ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_call_10, 90)) but using available operators simplified to ts_zscore(implied_volatility_call_10, 90). S1 used implied_volatility_call_10. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 high alphaCount. Confidence 0.72: normalized spikes are actionable.

ts_corr(implied_volatility_call_120, historical_volatility_120, 60). Low correlation indicates divergence. S1 used implied and realized fields. S2 not applied. S3 not necessary. S4 both fields have solid counts. Confidence 0.6: correlation signal can be unstable but informative.

results.idea: IV mean spread across tenors (mean 120 - mean 30)
results.description: subtract(implied_volatility_mean_120, implied_volatility_mean_30). S1 used two mean implied fields. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 used available mean fields. Confidence 0.71: cross-tenor mean spreads capture term premium structure.

subtract(parkinson_volatility_20, implied_volatility_call_20) to detect intraday vs option expectation mismatches. S1 used both fields. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 fields present. Confidence 0.62: useful to detect intraday risk not priced into options.
ts_ir(ts_returns(implied_volatility_put_60, 5), 60). S1 used implied_put_60. S2 N/A. S3 not needed. S4 put field has strong counts. Confidence 0.6: risk-adjusted return measure for put IV.

subtract(implied_volatility_mean_skew_360, implied_volatility_mean_skew_30). S1 used two mean_skew fields. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 mean_skew coverage slightly lower but acceptable. Confidence 0.58: skew slope informative for long-term tail premium but noisy.

ts_delta(subtract(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_call_30), 3). S1 used two tenors plus ts_delta. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 both fields are heavily used. Confidence 0.72: rapid flattening often reflects short-term demand shifts.

divide(implied_volatility_mean_270, implied_volatility_call_270) to see if average IV deviates proportionally from ATM call IV. S1 used two fields. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 used fields with strong counts. Confidence 0.67: ratio picks structural biases.

results.idea: Realized volatility reversion (30d zscore of delta)
results.description: ts_zscore(ts_delta(historical_volatility_30, 5), 30) to find extreme realized vol moves likely to revert. S1 used historical_volatility_30. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 used widely available hv. Confidence 0.65: realized reversion is tradable short-term.

ts_delta(implied_volatility_put_10, 1) to detect immediate protection demand spikes. S1 used implied_put_10. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 moderate userCount. Confidence 0.7: immediate jumps often precede directional hedging flows.

quantile(implied_volatility_call_60) to rank instruments into cross-sectional buckets. S1 used a single implied field for ranking. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 high alphaCount. Confidence 0.74: cross-sectional bucketing is robust for portfolio construction.

zscore(subtract(implied_volatility_put_60, implied_volatility_call_60)). S1 used put and call 60d. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 both fields strong. Confidence 0.76: normalized skew often outperforms raw levels.

ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_60, 10) measuring change in average IV. S1 used implied_volatility_mean_60. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 mean field moderate. Confidence 0.63: mean changes capture aggregate repricing.

ts_zscore(ts_delta(parkinson_volatility_30, 5), 30). S1 used parkinson_volatility_30. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 parkinson userCount moderate. Confidence 0.6: intraday-range momentum sometimes predictive.

zscore(implied_volatility_mean_skew_20) to detect stocks with extreme skew. S1 used implied_volatility_mean_skew_20. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 skew fields have lower userCount; used cautiously. Confidence 0.59: skew extremes can be noisy.

subtract(historical_volatility_60, parkinson_volatility_60) to find where close-to-close understates intraday. S1 used both realized and parkinson. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 fields available. Confidence 0.62: gap helpful for intraday risk strategies.

divide(implied_volatility_mean_skew_10, implied_volatility_mean_10). S1 used mean_skew_10 and mean_10. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 used mean fields with good userCount. Confidence 0.57: ratio exposes skew intensity relative to mean.

days_from_last_change(implied_volatility_call_30) to measure stale moves (operator available). S1 used implied_volatility_call_30. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 widely used field. Confidence 0.55: persistence metric useful for fade/time-based strategies.

results.idea: Term slope extreme bucket (quantile of slope 360-30)
results.description: quantile(subtract(implied_volatility_call_360, implied_volatility_call_30)). S1 used two call IV tenors and quantile for cross-sectional buckets. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 uses fields with good alpha counts. Confidence 0.7: bucketed slopes help portfolio tilts.

results.idea: Implied PUT volatility mean reversion zscore (150d)
results.description: ts_zscore(implied_volatility_put_150, 60). S1 used implied_put_150. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 put field has moderate userCount. Confidence 0.64: medium-term mean reversion viable for put IV.

subtract(ts_mean(implied_volatility_call_10,10), ts_mean(historical_volatility_10,10)). S1 used short-term means of implied and realized. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 both fields available. Confidence 0.68: short divergence often reverts quickly.

divide(implied_volatility_call_720, implied_volatility_call_30) to capture steepness. S1 used two tenors. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 used tenors with good counts. Confidence 0.7: strong term structure signal.

ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_60, 10). S1 used mean field. S2 not applied. S3 not necessary. S4 mean field has acceptable counts. Confidence 0.62: momentum in mean IV indicates changing aggregate demand.
ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_skew_60, 20). S1 used mean_skew_60. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 moderate userCount. Confidence 0.6: skew spikes are actionable but risky.

ts_delta(parkinson_volatility_10, 3) - ts_delta(historical_volatility_10, 3). S1 used parkinson and historical short-term. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 both fields present. Confidence 0.58: captures intraday vs close volatility divergence.

inverse(ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_call_120, 60)) to favor stable IV names. S1 used implied_volatility_call_120. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 high userCount. Confidence 0.56: stability useful for carry but less directional.

ts_delta(divide(implied_volatility_put_30, implied_volatility_call_30), 5). S1 used put and call 30d. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 both fields present. Confidence 0.68: shifts in ratio indicate changing hedging intensity.

results.idea: Implied mean high-low (vec proxy not available) using ts_max_diff
results.description: ts_max_diff(implied_volatility_mean_90, 90) as proxy for current vs recent max mean IV. S1 used implied_volatility_mean_90. S2 not applied (no vector). S3 not needed. S4 moderate counts. Confidence 0.57: highlights cheap vs recent highs.

results.idea: Realized volatility bucketed tail risk (quantile of hv 90)
results.description: quantile(historical_volatility_90) to bucket high realized vol names. S1 used historical_volatility_90. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 adequate userCount. Confidence 0.6: bucketed realized vol useful for hedging allocation.

subtract(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_mean_120) to find ATM deviation from mean. S1 used two related implied fields. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 fields have good counts. Confidence 0.71: ATM deviation often mean-reverts.

divide(ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_call_20, 30), ts_mean(implied_volatility_call_20, 60)). S1 used single field with ts operators. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 high alphaCount. Confidence 0.59: relative instability vs mean can guide position sizing.

results.idea: Term-structure pair trade (call 270 cheap vs call 30 rich)
results.description: subtract(implied_volatility_call_270, implied_volatility_call_30) and rank cross-sectionally (quantile). S1 used two call tenors and quantile idea. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 both fields widely used. Confidence 0.73: pair trades across tenors are diversified by construction.

subtract(implied_volatility_mean_skew_60, implied_volatility_call_60) to see skew relative to ATM. S1 used mean_skew and call. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 used available fields. Confidence 0.58: relative skew value is informative but lower coverage.

divide(ts_delta(parkinson_volatility_30, 5), ts_mean(parkinson_volatility_30, 60)). S1 used parkinson field with ts ops. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 parkinson userCount moderate. Confidence 0.56: normalized change useful for sizing.

results.idea: Implied short-term reversal (10d zscore of delta)
results.description: ts_zscore(ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_10, 1), 20). S1 used short-term implied. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 high alphaCount. Confidence 0.7: immediate reversals common after spikes.

divide(subtract(implied_volatility_put_90, implied_volatility_call_90), implied_volatility_mean_90). S1 used put, call, and mean_90 (3 fields) — to keep to 2 fields limit, simplify to divide(subtract(implied_volatility_put_90, implied_volatility_call_90), implied_volatility_call_90). S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 used high-count fields. Confidence 0.65: normalized skew improves comparability.

ts_arg_max(historical_volatility_30, 30) to detect if today is recent max. S1 used historical_volatility_30. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 used realized vol with decent counts. Confidence 0.54: breakout utility limited but useful in tails.

inverse(ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_mean_120, 60)). S1 used implied_volatility_mean_120. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 mean field userCount okay. Confidence 0.55: stability indicator for carry strategies.

ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_30, 3) negative extreme signals rapid decline. S1 used implied_volatility_call_30. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 high alphaCount. Confidence 0.65: declines often signal unwinding of hedges.

results.idea: Put IV relative to long-term (put_360 vs put_90)
results.description: subtract(implied_volatility_put_360, implied_volatility_put_90). S1 used two put tenors. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 put fields have high userCount (270/360). Confidence 0.66: long vs medium put structure reveals long-term hedging shifts.

subtract(implied_volatility_mean_10, ts_mean(implied_volatility_mean_30, 30)). S1 used short mean and longer mean. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 used mean fields. Confidence 0.6: short surprises often revert.

divide(implied_volatility_mean_skew_120, implied_volatility_mean_skew_30). S1 used two skew fields. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 skew fields have lower userCount; confidence lowered. Confidence 0.53: noisy but sometimes predictive of structural tail demand.

subtract(ts_delta(historical_volatility_20,1), ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_20,1)). S1 used both short-term realized and implied. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 used available fields. Confidence 0.61: day-over-day divergence can indicate mispricing.

results.idea: Implied call long-term zscore (1080d if available fallback 720d)
results.description: zscore(implied_volatility_call_720). S1 used long-term call IV. S2 not applied. S3 not necessary. S4 field has adequate counts. Confidence 0.6: long-term zscores identify structural outliers.

subtract(subtract(parkinson_volatility_120, parkinson_volatility_30), subtract(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_call_30)) simplified to subtract(subtract(parkinson_volatility_120, parkinson_volatility_30), subtract(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_call_30)) but to keep two fields, implement subtract(parkinson_volatility_120, implied_volatility_call_120). S1 attempted multi-field structure but KEEP_IN_MIND2 limits fields; used two fields. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 fields have good counts. Confidence 0.55: composite measure may be informative but reduced here.

results.idea: Implied volatility zscore scaled (zscore then scale)
results.description: normalize(zscore(implied_volatility_call_60)) simplified to zscore(implied_volatility_call_60) because normalize uses same effect. S1 used implied 60. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 high alphaCount. Confidence 0.66: scaled zscores are robust for ranking.

subtract(divide(subtract(implied_volatility_put_30, implied_volatility_call_30), implied_volatility_mean_30), 0) simplified to divide(subtract(implied_volatility_put_30, implied_volatility_call_30), implied_volatility_mean_30) but keep two fields: divide(subtract(implied_volatility_put_30, implied_volatility_call_30), implied_volatility_call_30). S1 used put & call. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 used widely available fields. Confidence 0.64: normalized gap reveals relative skew intensity.

results.idea: Implied mean ratio across long vs short (360/30)
results.description: divide(implied_volatility_mean_360, implied_volatility_mean_30). S1 used two mean fields. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 mean fields available. Confidence 0.65: ratio captures shift in average term premium.
ts_delta(historical_volatility_10, 3). S1 used short realized vol. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 hv_10 userCount moderate. Confidence 0.58: small-sample noise reduces confidence.

results.idea: Implied call vs put momentum divergence (60d)
results.description: subtract(ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_60, 5), ts_delta(implied_volatility_put_60, 5)). S1 used both call and put 60d. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 both fields have high counts. Confidence 0.66: divergence indicates changing directional hedging demand.

ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_120, 60). S1 used mean implied 120. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 mean field counts acceptable. Confidence 0.61: zscore on mean IV highlights cross-sectional opportunities.

subtract(ts_delta(parkinson_volatility_30, 5), ts_delta(historical_volatility_30, 5)). S1 used both parkinson and historical 30d. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 both fields present. Confidence 0.57: indicates intraday range shifts relative to close volatility.

zscore(implied_volatility_put_270). S1 used long-dated put IV. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 put_270 userCount very high. Confidence 0.72: long-dated put extremes are reliable for term-structure trades.

results.idea: Call IV mean vs short-tenor (call_120 - call_20)
results.description: subtract(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_call_20). S1 used two call tenors. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 both fields have strong counts. Confidence 0.69: tenor spread identifies relative steepness.

zscore(implied_volatility_mean_skew_720). S1 used a long-skew field. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 mean_skew_720 userCount lower—confidence reduced. Confidence 0.56: long-skew extremes informative for durable tail-premia.

ts_rank(historical_volatility_60, 120) to rank recent realized volatility within history. S1 used historical_volatility_60. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 historical fields common. Confidence 0.63: rank-based approaches robust to scale.

results.idea: Implied call-put divergence metric (zscore of difference 120d)
results.description: zscore(subtract(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_put_120)). S1 used call and put 120d. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 used widely used fields. Confidence 0.67: cross-sectional zscore of divergence captures relative demand.

ts_delta(subtract(implied_volatility_call_150, implied_volatility_call_30), 5). S1 used two tenors and ts_delta. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 fields have good counts. Confidence 0.7: slope reversion is a reliable mechanism.

results.idea: Implied mean short-term vs long-term ratio
results.description: divide(implied_volatility_mean_30, implied_volatility_mean_180). S1 used two mean tenors. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 both mean fields available. Confidence 0.64: ratio highlights skew in average term premium.
ts_zscore(parkinson_volatility_10, 10). S1 used short parkinson. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 parkinson_10 moderate userCount. Confidence 0.58: short parkinson spikes often revert intraday.

ts_corr(implied_volatility_put_60, implied_volatility_call_60, 60). Low correlation suggests structural shifts. S1 used put and call 60d. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 both fields strong. Confidence 0.59: correlation shifts informative but can be episodic.

ts_arg_max(implied_volatility_mean_10, 10) to detect new highs in mean IV. S1 used implied_volatility_mean_10. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 mean_10 moderate counts. Confidence 0.52: breakout detection limited sample but can catch fresh repricing.

divide(subtract(implied_volatility_call_30, historical_volatility_30), implied_volatility_call_30). S1 used two fields. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 both fields present. Confidence 0.7: normalized difference highlights relative mispricing robustly.
ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, 5). S1 used mean_skew_30. S2 not applied. S3 not necessary. S4 skew counts moderate. Confidence 0.56: short skew change informative but less stable.

results.idea: Call IV oversold indicator (zscore of recent decline)
results.description: zscore(ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_20, 3)). S1 used implied call 20 time-series. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 high alphaCount. Confidence 0.68: oversold IV often mean-reverts

results.idea: Term volatility ratio (150d realized vs implied)
results.description: divide(historical_volatility_150, implied_volatility_call_150). S1 combined realized and implied long-tenor. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 fields have good counts. Confidence 0.63: long-term realized vs implied ratio indicates regime changes.

zscore(implied_volatility_mean_270). S1 used long-term mean field. S2 not applied. S3 not needed (coverage ok). S4 mean_270 userCount lower but acceptable. Confidence 0.6: long-term zscore valuable for structural positioning.

divide(parkinson_volatility_30, historical_volatility_30). S1 used both parkinson and historical. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 both fields available. Confidence 0.58: ratio indicates intraday vs close volatility balance.

days_from_last_change(implied_volatility_call_10). S1 used implied_volatility_call_10. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 high alphaCount. Confidence 0.53: persistence metric helps filter stale signals.

quantile(subtract(implied_volatility_mean_120, implied_volatility_mean_30)). S1 used two mean fields and quantile. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 mean fields have good counts. Confidence 0.66: cross-tenor mean spreads are practical for portfolio tilts.

zscore(divide(implied_volatility_put_30, implied_volatility_call_30)). S1 used put and call 30d. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 both fields widely used. Confidence 0.71: normalized ratio zscore effectively isolates extremes.

divide(ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_60, 5), ts_mean(implied_volatility_call_60, 120)). S1 used single field with ts ops. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 strong usage counts. Confidence 0.62: relative change to mean helps sizing decisions.

results.idea: Implied mean skew ratio vs call (30d)
results.description: divide(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, implied_volatility_call_30). S1 used skew and call fields. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 skew fields less used; lowered confidence. Confidence 0.54: less stable but highlights skew intensity.

divide(historical_volatility_10, historical_volatility_30) to detect acute spikes vs medium-term. S1 used two hv fields. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 hv fields solid. Confidence 0.63: ratio identifies acute spikes effectively.
zscore(implied_volatility_call_30). S1 used call 30d. S2 not applied. S3 not needed. S4 strong field usage. Confidence 0.75: cross-sectional zscore of ATM IV is a high-confidence short-term signal.

subtract(implied_volatility_put_720, implied_volatility_put_60). S1 used two put tenors. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 both fields present. Confidence 0.65: long-short put slope signals long-term hedging shifts.

subtract(implied_volatility_mean_180, historical_volatility_180). S1 used mean implied and realized long-term. S2 not applied. S3 not required. S4 used robust fields. Confidence 0.7: long-term discrepancies often persist and are tradeable.
